misdeed: People are disappearing from a village situated near a lake, last seen wandering towards the water's edge as if in a trance. Their bodies are never recovered, but strange music is sometimes heard drifting across the water at night.
solution: The Vaesen is the Neck and can be banished by luring him to a place surrounded by Christian symbols and iron.

clues.description: Witnesses describe seeing a solitary figure playing a haunting melody on a flute or fiddle near the lakeâ€™s edge. He vanishes when approached.
Local legends speak of a water spirit who lures people to their deaths with his enchanting music.
A strange, alluring melody lingers in the air near the lake, even when no one is playing an instrument.
A silver button, engraved with a musical note, is found near the spot where one of the victims was last seen.
The water of the lake seems to ripple and dance, even when there is no wind.
A fisherman claims to have pulled a strange, three-eyed fish from the lake, but it slipped from his net and disappeared back into the depths.

plotTwist.description: The local tavern owner, seeking to drum up business, has made a deal with the Vaesen for a song that will draw people to his establishment, unaware of the true cost.
